abstract: The Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation recently revoked contracts with BlackRock, Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase based on questions surrounding how the formal bidding process was run.
snippet: The Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation recently revoked contracts with BlackRock, Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase based on questions surrounding how the formal bidding process was run.
lead_paragraph: As a New York money manager and investment banker at four Wall Street firms, Charles E. F. Millard never reached superstar status. But he was treated like one when he arrived in Washington in May 2007, to run the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation, the federal agency that oversees $50 billion in retirement funds, The New York Times’s Eric Lipton reports.

headline.main: Wooing a U.S. Agency With Billions to Invest

abstract: CoveView Advisors, a new firm led by former high-level bankers at what is now JPMorgan Chase that is officially announcing its formation on Wednesday, says it brings something new to the sector: expertise in the business of finding money when it’s difficult to locate.
snippet: CoveView Advisors, a new firm led by former high-level bankers at what is now JPMorgan Chase that is officially announcing its formation on Wednesday, says it brings something new to the sector: expertise in the business of finding money when it’s...
lead_paragraph: Few fields are more popular in finance these days than restructuring. Still, CoveView Advisors, a new firm led by former high-level bankers at what is now JPMorgan Chase, says it brings something new to the sector.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Executives from Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase had tense exchanges with commodities regulators at a hearing Wednesday, as they faced questions about the “firewalls” that banks put up between their research and trading arms.
snippet: Executives from Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase had tense exchanges with commodities regulators at a hearing Wednesday, as they faced questions about the “firewalls” that banks put up between their research and trading arms.
lead_paragraph: Facing tough questions from regulators, executives from Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase said on Wednesday they were willing to allow the government to keep tabs on how well they separate their commodities research units from their trading arms.

headline.main: Goldman and JPMorgan Defend Commodity Firewalls
